sentences.sentence: In Tel Aviv, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has urged Israel to enhance civilian protections and allow more aid into Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Blinken told a press conference that Israel must be a partner with Palestinian leaders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Blinken also said he had promises from four Arab nations and Turkey to help rebuild Gaza after the war, but that that aid was contingent on progress towards a Palestinian state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He reiterated the enormous cost the war was having on Palestinian lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We know that facing an enemy that embeds itself among civilians, who hides in and fires from schools, from hospitals, makes this incredibly challenging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the daily toll on civilians in Gaza, particularly on children, is far too high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, a UK Defense Intelligence Review says that Russia's air defense is unable to keep important locations protected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Nonetheless, Russia's recent escalation of missile and drone attacks is stretching Ukraine's air defense resources. A Ukrainian Air Force official said on Tuesday, the country is vulnerable in the war unless it can secure further weapons supplies.

La cérémonie a-t-elle promis de prior-être surtout de la confiance, celle accordée à la jeunesse, cette génération qui mérite que l'on se batte pour elle sans relâche.

sentences.sentence: Attal's predecessor, Born, resigned on Monday. Amid speculation, Macron would cull her in his cabinet reshuffle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Many see the reshuffle as a way to align with France's far right, who are surging in the polls ahead of June's EU elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Macron also hopes that his new, youthful prime minister will help implement further political reforms during the remainder of his presidency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: German politician Sarah Wagenknecht has formally launched a new party that could shake things up in the election year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Sarah Wagenknecht Alliance, Reason and Justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The party will offer a combination of left-wing economic policies with a restrictive approach to migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Wagenknecht has previously questioned plans to combat climate change and opposes German arms supplies to Ukraine as well as sanctions on Russia. The party launches at a time where Chancellor Olaf Scholz's three-party coalition is deeply unpopular.

The popular tourist destination features a string of emerald colored lakes and is only accessible by boat and raft. Rescue workers say the hours-long operation on Monday only became possible when the water levels dropped. Officials say all five are in good spirits and were not in need of medical help.

sentences.sentence: It was the perfect liftoff for the first United States attempt at a moon landing in over 50 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: South Korea's parliament on Tuesday passed a landmark ban on production and sales of dog meat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The bill would make slaughtering, breeding and sales of dog meat for human consumption illegal from 2027 and punishable by two to three years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It doesn't provide any penalties for eating dog meat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Dog meat consumption is a centuries-old practice on the Korean peninsula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Recent surveys show that more than half of South Koreans want dog meat banned and that a majority no longer eat it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: After 12 months which saw new daily and monthly record highs, 2023 has been confirmed as the hottest year to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In its annual global report, Europe's Copernicus Space and Climate Data Agency says unprecedented temperatures from June onwards led 2023 to surpass 2016 as the warmest year so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The data charts the rise of global surface temperatures relative to pre-industrial levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It shows daily averages briefly topped them by more than 2 degrees Celsius at certain points in the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Across the world, the extreme impact was evident in extensive wildfires and sustained heat waves, which may have been intensified by the El Nino weather phenomenon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Temperatures in Europe were above average for 11 months of the year, and 2023 saw the warmest September on record. The report also extrapolates that a 12-month period ending in January or February 2024 would exceed the 1.5 degrees Celsius global temperature rise level that the UN says would trigger irreversible climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The average litre of bottled water has nearly a quarter million invisible pieces of ever-so-tiny nanoplastics, detected and categorised for the first time by a microscope using dual lasers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Researchers at Columbia and Rogers University discovered about 10 to 100 times more nanoplastics than microplastics in bottled water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

So it's better that we actually know how much is out there and what they are. myself as a scientist, I would want more data in terms of the toxicology study to actually know how harmful it would be to my own body." Nanoplastics are particles that are less than a micron in size.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A human hair is about 83 microns wide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: To answer the big question as to whether nanoplastic pieces are harmful to our health, experts agree that the new study opens doors to better understanding of the potential risks.
